version_description: Bug fixes and stabilization improvements.
Bug fixes and stabilization improvements.

Additional model support
: DR750S-1CH & DR750S-2CH

Additional model support
: DR750S-1CH & DR750S-2CH

This version adds:
- Slow motion video playback:
Play videos stored on your phone in slow motion. The video must be first downloaded to your phone via Wi-Fi direct connection or over the Cloud. Downloaded videos are accessible from the Internal Memory menu of the app.
- One-tap full screen video:
Simply switch to full screen video when viewing a video by holding your phone horizontally and tapping the video window.

This version adds:
- Slow motion video playback:
Play videos stored on your phone in slow motion. The video must be first downloaded to your phone via Wi-Fi direct connection or over the Cloud. Downloaded videos are accessible from the Internal Memory menu of the app.
- One-tap full screen video:
Simply switch to full screen video when viewing a video by holding your phone horizontally and tapping the video window.

1. Improved FOTA upgrade process and interface.
FOTA, or Firmware Over The Air lets you upgrade the firmware of your BlackVue dashcam over Wi-Fi.
- Download the latest firmware for your dashcam via the BlackVue App’s Firmware Download menu (swipe from left to right in the Main Menu).
- Connect to your dashcam via your phone’s Wi-Fi menu and go to the BlackVue App’s BLACKVUE WI-FI menu > gear icon > Firmware Upgrade (FOTA).
2. Fixed an issue occurring with the map display when using Baidu Map.

1. Improved FOTA upgrade process and interface.
FOTA, or Firmware Over The Air lets you upgrade the firmware of your BlackVue dashcam over Wi-Fi.
- Download the latest firmware for your dashcam via the BlackVue App’s Firmware Download menu (swipe from left to right in the Main Menu).
- Connect to your dashcam via your phone’s Wi-Fi menu and go to the BlackVue App’s BLACKVUE WI-FI menu > gear icon > Firmware Upgrade (FOTA).
2. Fixed an issue occurring with the map display when using Baidu Map.

This version introduces fixes for iPhone X and iOS 11 users:
1. Optimized user interface on iPhone X.
2. Enhanced compatibility. - iOS 11.
Fixed 'Photos' access permission error which prevented users from saving videos to their photo library* (iOS 11 and up).
(*) To save a video to your Photo Library, go to INTERNAL MEMORY to access videos downloaded from your dashcam to your device > Tap the 3-dot icon next to a video file > Select Share > Save Video.
You can also use this option to share your video via other apps.

This version introduces fixes for iPhone X and iOS 11 users:
1. Optimized user interface on iPhone X.
2. Enhanced compatibility. - iOS 11.
Fixed 'Photos' access permission error which prevented users from saving videos to their photo library* (iOS 11 and up).
(*) To save a video to your Photo Library, go to INTERNAL MEMORY to access videos downloaded from your dashcam to your device > Tap the 3-dot icon next to a video file > Select Share > Save Video.
You can also use this option to share your video via other apps.

1. Scheduled Reboot added to DR650S Series.
* It supports from firmware version v1.009 or higher.
Minimize risks of errors when your BlackVue is constantly powered by letting it reboot at a set time.
It will only reboot in Parking Mode and when nothing is being recorded, so you do not have to worry about missing important files.
To activate Scheduled reboot, go to BLACKVUE WI-FI > Gear icon > Firmware settings > Other > Set scheduled reboot.

2. Bug fixes and stabilization improvements.

1. Scheduled Reboot added to DR650S Series.
* It supports from firmware version v1.009 or higher.
Minimize risks of errors when your BlackVue is constantly powered by letting it reboot at a set time.
It will only reboot in Parking Mode and when nothing is being recorded, so you do not have to worry about missing important files.
To activate Scheduled reboot, go to BLACKVUE WI-FI > Gear icon > Firmware settings > Other > Set scheduled reboot.

2. Bug fixes and stabilization improvements.

- Added DR590W Series support.
- Wi-Fi connection scenario improvement (popup linking to phone’s Wi-Fi network settings if not connected to dashcam).
- Live Auto-upload (beta): let your dashcam save to the Cloud a one-minute 480p stream in real time when an Event is detected.
Compatible models:
DR750S Series (FW 1.004 and up)
DR650S Series (FW 1.011 and up)
Toggle this option in the Account Settings menu of the app.
Change settings under BLACKVUE CLOUD > Camera Settings > Live Auto-upload settings.

- Introducing BlackVue Cloud Basic and Smart Subscription Plans.
Free Plan: Default
Basic Plan [$9.99 USD/month]: Unlimited Live View, 10GB of Cloud storage, 300 replays or downloads per month for 1 BlackVue dashcam.
Smart Plan [$19.99 USD/month]: Unlimited Live View, 15GB of Cloud storage, 600 replays or downloads per month for up to 3 dashcams.
Subscriptions will be charged to the user’s iTunes Account at the time of confirmation of purchase and will automatically renew monthly, unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.
Dashcam slots are no longer available for purchase. Purchased slots will carry over under the Free Plan. Basic Plan is not available to users who own one or more extra slots.

- [DR750S] Added ‘Extreme mode(25mbps)’ & Night Vision only in Parking mode.

- Added DR590W Series support.
- Wi-Fi connection scenario improvement (popup linking to phone’s Wi-Fi network settings if not connected to dashcam).
- Live Auto-upload (beta): let your dashcam save to the Cloud a one-minute 480p stream in real time when an Event is detected.
Compatible models:
DR750S Series (FW 1.004 and up)
DR650S Series (FW 1.011 and up)

Change settings under BLACKVUE CLOUD > Camera Settings > Live Auto-upload settings.

Subscriptions will be charged to the user’s iTunes Account at the time of confirmation of purchase and will automatically renew monthly, unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

Bug fixes and stabilization improvements.
Bug fixes and stabilization improvements.

1. New Time Lapse Parking Mode, including Time Lapse + Buffered Event videos in case of impact (Firmware settings > Basic > Recording > Parking mode recording).
2. Region-based Motion Detection: activate/deactivate Parking Mode motion detection areas for front and rear cameras.
3. Added Rear Camera native mirror view recording setting (…Recording > Rear camera orientation).
4. New Fleet Plan available. Enable BlackVue Fleet Tracking features right from the app (Main Menu > Add paid features).

1. New Time Lapse Parking Mode, including Time Lapse + Buffered Event videos in case of impact (Firmware settings > Basic > Recording > Parking mode recording).
2. Region-based Motion Detection: activate/deactivate Parking Mode motion detection areas for front and rear cameras.
3. Added Rear Camera native mirror view recording setting (…Recording > Rear camera orientation).
4. New Fleet Plan available. Enable BlackVue Fleet Tracking features right from the app (Main Menu > Add paid features).

1. Add features to ‘Fleet Plan Subscription’

Driving Reports compatibility (BlackVue Fleet Tracking):
Driving Reports is a BlackVue Fleet Tracking feature that allows users to view a summary of one's vehicle/dashcam activity over the past 90 days.
Statistics include: driver details, distance driven, travel time, no. of idle stops, idling time, no. of Parking Mode sessions, parked time, no. of times a GPS signal was not found, time without a GPS signal, speed report (no. of speeding alerts, highest speed, average speed), no. of Events (while parked and while driving), geo-fencing report (no. entries/exits/time within a geo-fenced zone).

Note: For the Driving Reports to function properly, the dashcam must be connected to the Cloud at all times.
Driving data are uploaded to the Cloud every minute.
If disconnected from the Cloud, the dashcam will keep in memory up to 60 minutes of driving data and upload them to the Cloud upon re-establishing a connection.

To access the Driving reports:
BlackVue Viewer : Fleet tracking > Driving reports.
BlackVue App: BLACKVUE CLOUD > tap on a dashcams' name > tap on the Driving Reports icon.

※ Compatible model & firmware version:
1) DR900S-1/2CH FW v1.005 and up.
2) DR750S-1/2CH FW v1.011 and up.

1. Add features to ‘Fleet Plan Subscription’

Driving Reports compatibility (BlackVue Fleet Tracking):
Driving Reports is a BlackVue Fleet Tracking feature that allows users to view a summary of one's vehicle/dashcam activity over the past 90 days.
Statistics include: driver details, distance driven, travel time, no. of idle stops, idling time, no. of Parking Mode sessions, parked time, no. of times a GPS signal was not found, time without a GPS signal, speed report (no. of speeding alerts, highest speed, average speed), no. of Events (while parked and while driving), geo-fencing report (no. entries/exits/time within a geo-fenced zone).

Note: For the Driving Reports to function properly, the dashcam must be connected to the Cloud at all times.
Driving data are uploaded to the Cloud every minute.
If disconnected from the Cloud, the dashcam will keep in memory up to 60 minutes of driving data and upload them to the Cloud upon re-establishing a connection.

To access the Driving reports:
BlackVue Viewer : Fleet tracking > Driving reports.
BlackVue App: BLACKVUE CLOUD > tap on a dashcams' name > tap on the Driving Reports icon.

1. Added features to settings.
Rear camera recording in parking mode ON/OFF.
ON - Front and rear camera record together.
OFF - Rear camera stops recording 5 minutes after entering parking mode.
Recording restarts when entering normal mode.

Fixed playback problem in internal memory.

Cloud Privacy update. Privacy by default.
We have updated every BlackVue Over the Cloud and BlackVue Fleet Tracking dashcam privacy settings to private. This is a server-side update. Users who wish to share their BlackVue dashcam name, video or audio publicly may do so under BLACKVUE CLOUD > Camera settings > Privacy settings.
Additionally, the dashcam Cloud registration process has been updated so sharing settings are set to private by default when registering a new camera.

Cloud Privacy update. Privacy by default.
We have updated every BlackVue Over the Cloud and BlackVue Fleet Tracking dashcam privacy settings to private. This is a server-side update. Users who wish to share their BlackVue dashcam name, video or audio publicly may do so under BLACKVUE CLOUD > Camera settings > Privacy settings.
Additionally, the dashcam Cloud registration process has been updated so sharing settings are set to private by default when registering a new camera.

[BlackVue Over the Cloud] Following recent changes introduced by Facebook, we are no longer able to support Facebook Live streaming from Cloud-compatible BlackVue dashcams.
This version removes the menu formerly found under BLACKVUE CLOUD > Camera options (3-dot icon) > Broadcast > Facebook.

Get notifications when an Event video recording starts and completes.

1. Modified Facebook Live to address Facebook policy changes.
Temporarily modified to allow Facebook Live broadcasting, albeit through a Facebook Page only at the moment. This means you can broadcast to any Facebook Page for which you are an Administrator. We are currently exploring ways to bring back broadcasting to personal Facebook accounts.

2. Added Terms & Policies in Japanese.
Will display when your phone’s language is set to Japanese.

3. [DR900S Series]: fixed an issue that caused the FOTA upgrade to fail when the firmware language was set to Norwegian.

This update introduces Dark Mode support, Live Event upload (now with buffer!) and tons of user interface improvements.

1. User Interface (UI) improvements:
1) Improved Home screen UI
2) Simplified Cloud account registration process
3) Built-in Cloud connection guide for newly registered cameras
4) Improved account settings UI
5) Dark Mode (iOS 13 or higher)
6) Group display in camera list (Fleet Plan only)
7) Camera Parking Mode status display in camera list
8) Map View tutorial display
9) File list UI improvements
10) Map display on Parking Mode videos playback

2. New Hard Acceleration, Hard Braking, Hard Cornering detection function added.
Applies to: original video files, Live Event upload files, Notification, warning sound, GPS tracking, Drive Report.

3. Cloud storage policy changes:
- Upload capacity and file storage period changes
- Added storage alert notifications

4. Live Event upload function improvements:
- Combined benefits of Live Event Auto upload and Event File Auto upload.
- Includes 5-second pre-impact buffer + saving to the Cloud in real time

5. Geofence-related Event videos upload function added.
Note: the original file is still saved on the microSD card as a normal recording.

6. Notifications improvements:
- Integrated notification settings into a single menu
- Simplified Quick View Events Push Notifications

7. Improved Cloud firmware settings function:
- Firmware settings can be changed while not connected to the Cloud
- Most settings apply immediately without dashcam reboot
- Cloud hotspot (SSID / PW) settings added

8. GPS location recording ON / OFF setting added

Dashcam models and firmware support for new features:
- DR750S FW v1.018 and up
- DR900S FW v1.013 and up
- DR750-2CH LTE FW v1.007 and up
- DR750X FW v1.006 and up
- DR900X FW v1.006 and up
- DR750X Plus FW v1.001 and up

This update introduces Dark Mode support, Live Event upload (now with buffer!) and tons of user interface improvements.

1. User Interface (UI) improvements:
1) Improved Home screen UI
2) Simplified Cloud account registration process
3) Built-in Cloud connection guide for newly registered cameras
4) Improved account settings UI
5) Dark Mode (iOS 13 or higher)
6) Group display in camera list (Fleet Plan only)
7) Camera Parking Mode status display in camera list
8) Map View tutorial display
9) File list UI improvements
10) Map display on Parking Mode videos playback

2. New Hard Acceleration, Hard Braking, Hard Cornering detection function added.
Applies to: original video files, Live Event upload files, Notification, warning sound, GPS tracking, Drive Report.

3. Cloud storage policy changes:
- Upload capacity and file storage period changes
- Added storage alert notifications

4. Live Event upload function improvements:
- Combined benefits of Live Event Auto upload and Event File Auto upload.
- Includes 5-second pre-impact buffer + saving to the Cloud in real time

5. Geofence-related Event videos upload function added.
Note: the original file is still saved on the microSD card as a normal recording.

6. Notifications improvements:
- Integrated notification settings into a single menu
- Simplified Quick View Events Push Notifications

7. Improved Cloud firmware settings function:
- Firmware settings can be changed while not connected to the Cloud
- Most settings apply immediately without dashcam reboot
- Cloud hotspot (SSID / PW) settings added

8. GPS location recording ON / OFF setting added

Dashcam models and firmware support for new features:
- DR750S FW v1.018 and up
- DR900S FW v1.013 and up
- DR750-2CH LTE FW v1.007 and up
- DR750X FW v1.006 and up
- DR900X FW v1.006 and up
- DR750X Plus FW v1.001 and up

1) Added support for DR900X Plus.
2) Added Seamless Pairing support: connect to your BlackVue directly from the app (no need to connect first from your phone’s Wi-Fi menu).
3) Firmware settings updates:
a. Removed Night Vision and Brightness settings.
b. Added Hard acceleration, Hard braking and Hard cornering Event toggles.
c. Improved built-in Battery Protection settings (when hardwiring the dashcam).
- Cut-off timer: when activated, can now be set freely in 1-hour increments from 1 to 48 hours.
- Low voltage cut-off: can now be set freely in 0.1V increments between 11.8 and 12.5V for Passenger Vehicle (12V) and between 22.8 and 24V for Heavy Vehicle (24V).
